name: Sheraton Miami Airport Hotel

reviews.text: I had an overnight layover in Miami and wanted somewhere close to the airport for the few short hours I would have to sleep. The Sheraton at MIA is within a five minute drive from the terminal and was quite convenient. When I got on the hotel shuttle, the driver asked if I was a Starwood member, and when I answered "yes', he radioed ahead to the front desk that I was on the way. When I arrived at the reception desk, they quickly checked me in and gave me my room key.
reviews.title: Convenient Stopover Point

reviews.text: The room was comfortable and the staff were efficient. The hotel shuttle leaves every 15 minutes, so getting back to the airport for an early morning departure was not a problem. If i have another stopover in Miami, I would not hesitate to book the airport Sheraton.
reviews.title: more like a slightly better motel 6

reviews.text: The good - closest to airport, frequent free shuttle, friendly staff (but they never follow up on promises)
reviews.title: served its purpose....

reviews.text: The bad - old very poorly maintained rooms, understaffed so everything takes forever and the phone is either not answered by front desk or only answered after 30 (I'm not kidding) rings or so. No one takes responsibility to follow up on promises - staff doesn't seem to have power to correct problems and management is MIA:(
reviews.title: Very Cloe to the airport.

reviews.text: After waiting just a little too long for the shuttle but happy had 24 hour shuttle, was happy the hotel was so close to airport. After 18 hours of flights not bothered that this is a rather dated hotel conversion and little worn. The room was fine, but the pizza flyers under the door indicated that good the room had good security lock as these always make me realize they dont have as good security as they should.
reviews.title: Great Time in Miami! Thanks, Paul!

reviews.text: Booked this room for two nights beginning Aug 2nd. Reception and Bell service was prompt given the conditions (two children trying to negotiate access to their room without a parent?) Check in was courteous, signed up for the frequent stay program in the off chance that I ever frequent another Sheraton...who knows?
reviews.title: Chaotic - Average accomodations at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon entering the room, I found the remote control to be unresponsive. Ordinarily this would be no problem, just call maintenance and have them come up and fix it. However, what should have been a simple call ended up being a 20 minute wait. After calling for the remote, I find I have no bar soap in my room, not even liquid soap..just shampoo and lotion. Again, not a problem. However, this required two phone calls and 20 minutes as well.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: The housekeeping lady was abrupt, nothing spectacular about her delivery of the soap...quite average I suppose. The maintenance man was very friendly and traced the problem to what was likely the prior guest trying to hook up something to the television. So about 30 minutes after check-in, I could finally relax.
reviews.title: Conveniently located 5 minutes away from the airport

reviews.text: As for the room....it was just average. Standard size, mini fridge, small bathroom...nothing stood out as being extraordinary..which with the Sheraton name, I sort of expected. I should note at this point that I booked this room via Hotwire, so truth be known, I have little to complain about. The reason I review rooms is not to condemn, but because I know that hotel management reads these reviews. By sharing my experience, other guests can gauge their reaction to my troubles and perhaps report back with more positive experiences as a result.
reviews.title: So much has happened - and I've only been here for an hour!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all I suppose I'll get a good nights sleep. I wrote this only two hours after check-in, so we'll see how I feel when I check out.
reviews.title: Always a pleasant place to stay near the airport

reviews.text: This hotel is unchanged from the Wyndham it was a year ago. It is a good option if you have a car and do not expect much. Otherwise stay someplace else.
reviews.title: Decent value for a business stay

reviews.text: We had a good time at the hotel, was nice and the service was excellent. The employees was very helpful and friendly special at restourant at breakfast time when we was served by a fantastic employee Francisco Rocha whom took the time to to answer my son 11 years questions. The Hotel Sharaton is very luck to have a exceptional employee like him, my son did't want to leave and I told to we'll be back. Thanksfor the great experience.
reviews.title: my son and I loved,and for shore we'll be back.

reviews.text: The worst thing about this hotel is the parking (especially at night). The walk from the parking structure needs to have more light. Only half the lights on the roof work. Its a little creepy. Room was very nice. Got upgraded to a Pure room because of my SPG status. Nice lobby and everyone who worked at the hotel was very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Airport hotel....

reviews.text: With more than 4 million miles in the last 15 years, I've stayed at a bunch of hotels, and always cringe when I see the client has booked me at an airport hotel. Not this one - great staff, particularly Ernesto who works with planning and executing meeting rooms and events. Nice pool, good views, excellent food, good business center with free printing and faxing, comfortable sleeping room. I will be glad to return to this airport hotel!
reviews.title: Best stateside airport hotel I have ever stayed at

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Miami Sheraton on our way out of town, I was skeptical at first coming from working at a large hospitality chain and hving high expectations that is not under the Sheraton branch but to my amazment there were suprises around every corner,
reviews.title: Great Stay, try it you will be suprised!

reviews.text: A typical Sheraton Hotel, nice reception hall, clean rooms, good fitness area, good food in the restaurant. Pool has sun from morning till eveining and it's 24 hours accesible.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff and a good overall impression. This hotel is good not only for an overnight stay if you land in Miami. Good connections to nearby local attractions (Everglades)
reviews.title: Airport Stopover plus a round of golf
Helpful staff
reviews.text: This was a stopover at the start of vacation, as I was waiting for my wife to arrive in town. The hotel is OK - the only reason I stayed here was because of the proximity to the airport, it was a Starwood property, and the pool looked decent. I got a very good deal, so I think it was decent for the price.

My room was somewhat dated - a good size, but everything could use a refresh. I ate a dinner and a lunch at the restaurant - the food was OK, nothing spectacular. Other guests seemed to be doing a conference or a stopover like I was.
reviews.title: beware of parking costs & local calls from room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was pretty good - had some good help getting over to a nearby restaurant to watch a basketball game (odd that I couldn't watch it at the hotel...) - and the food at the restaurant ended up being good too. The locals are friendly and happy hour was very fun. The second day, after looking at the golf course, I decided to head down for a round.
reviews.title: 5 STAR SERVICE

description: Located minutes from Miami's airport, our hotel provides the perfect venue for business meetings, conferences, and seminars. Contact us to day to plan the perfect event.
